subSections.title: Kanji
Readings
Etymology
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|ひき}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ひき}} {{m|zh|疋|tr=srjo||foot; roll of cloth}}. Conflated in Japanese with {{etyl|ltc|-}} {{m|zh|匹|tr=phjit||counter for horses and mules; counter for rolls of cloth}}, both in meaning and in reading. The ''hichi'' reading evolved into ''hiki'' by association with {{m|ja|引き|tr=hiki||pulling}}, from the way that an animal's [[leash]] is [[pull]]ed.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

subSections.title: Counter
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|ひき|counter}}

# {{alternative form of|lang=ja|sort=ひき|匹}}: [[counter]] for smaller [[animal]]s
